page.title: 01Upper Ebble and Beyond
page.content:
The Ebble flowing, basically, from east to west, is bounded by chalk downlands which rise in the north bank a hundred metres above it. There, deep but dry valleys incise the downs roughly at right angles to the bourn. In the extreme north west the high ground falls away sharply. To south of the Ebble,the land rises less dramatically, though Windmill Hill and Barrow Hill are notable heights.
Both Ebbesbourne Wake and Alvediston were developed during and since Victorian times. However, a few cottages retain the charm of an earlier period. Because the two villages are small and remote, there is a lively community spirit, but the populations are ageing.
